name: Headless Duck
description:
Introduction

Headless duck is best described as an enjoyable hike with spectacular views followed by a short but interesting technical canyon. Can be completed in 2-3 hours if doing the crack approach, which requires two brief Class IV climbing moves.

Approach

Descent

A couple spicey DCâ€™s are available at the top if you want fun. Belly of the Whale cavern halfway down on right. Huge arch on left just before final rap. Short canyon so be sure to explore all the side drainages or it will be a very forgettable day.

Once you arrive a the top of the canyon, hike down the right side of the canyon and bypass the first few drops. Downclimb into the canyon just before it gets tight. This might take a few minutes to figure out, but it is faster than rigging a couple of needless rappels in the watercourse.

Once you arrive at the skinny section, you will downclimb two drops that are about 25 feet in height. Beginners might want a belay on the second downclimb. After the two downclimbs, take a moment to enjoy a large natural bridge on the left downcanyon side.

All too soon you will arrive at the final rappel, which is 150 feet down a vertical wall. Take care not to groove the rock or core-shot your ropes. Some form of rope/webbing protection is recommended here. A shirt or jacket works well.

After the one and only rappel, scramble down the boulders for about 5 minutes back to the Burr Trail Road.

Exit

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

https://www.smilingcricket.com/2019/10/headless-duck-exploration.html
